root.TEXT:

INTERNAL MEDICINE ASSOCIATES
FOLSOM CONVALESCENT HOSPITAL

Annual Examination

s/p bypass 5 vessel 6/16/2069
Dr. Delarosa and Dr. Land

resolved off Altace

No erections for two years. Thinking about Viagra. Asked Dr. Delarosa in June 2070 who advised against use.

s/p TURP X 2 ( In PH)

New symptom. Decreased sensation at finger tips - 2nd,3rd, and 4th digits. Also notes suble weakness with change in handwriting. 8/29/71 Carpal tunnel per EMG/NCS 1/3/72

Negative work up by Dr. Villalobos (cystoscopy , CT) 2073

Feels legs are heavy. No pain. Upright position.

Family history
Social history
Still active in business. He is Treasurer for the Masons. Does not smoke. Drinks a few glasses of wine or Martini at night. He has 10 grandchildren.
Habits/Risk Screening
Smoking status: never smoked
Alcohol use status: moderate
Activity level: moderate
Review of systems
Leg cramps. Early fatigue. No chest pain, SOB, GI or GU issues
Physical examination
Blood pressure 140/80
Pulse 72 and regular
Respiratory rate 16
Weight 185
General appearance Well developed, well nourished, no acute distress.
Skin groin rash
Heent NC/AT, PERRL, EOMI, O/P clear without erythema or exudates.
Neck Carotids, no bruits. Thyroid, nonpalpable
Nodes No cervical, axillary or groin adenopathy appreciated.
Chest Clear to auscultation bilaterally. scar
Cor PMI at 5th ICS, MCL. RRR nl s1, s2 without m/r/g.
Abdomen NT/ND, no HSM. Normal active bowel sounds.
Rectal exam Guaiac negative. Prostate, slightly enlarged
Genitalia Genitalia, within normal
Extrem Within normal limits. Pulses intact. He has fungal infections of his nails on his feet
Musc skel Stands, walks , squats w/o difficulty. pulses intact strength intact. DTRs intact
Assessment and plan
Severe spinal stenosis. CAD/CABG stable. Lipid, BS, BP managed. Tinea start ketoconazole. BPH. Weight issues. H/o SCC.
Disposition
rtc 3 months
